While I understand the argument for sanctuary cities fostering trust between immigrant communities and law enforcement, I believe that establishing such cities can have unintended consequences. By not fully cooperating with federal immigration authorities, sanctuary cities risk enabling individuals who have committed serious crimes to evade deportation. This can potentially pose a threat to public safety by allowing dangerous individuals to remain in the community. Therefore, prioritizing immigration status over other criminal activities may have negative repercussions on the overall safety and well-being of the community.

Expanding Medicare access should be part of a comprehensive healthcare reform strategy that addresses not only preventive care but also systemic issues within the healthcare system. By leveraging the bargaining power of a larger Medicare program, we can negotiate lower drug prices, streamline administrative processes, and implement cost-saving measures to ensure the sustainability of the healthcare system. This holistic approach will not only improve access to care but also tackle the root causes of high healthcare spending and disparities.
